title.narrative: F.a: More responsible sourcing from Vietnam?

description.narrative: The project is a study on long term impacts of a project implemented in 2006-2009 in Vietnam with SAK and Finnish retail companies. The project aimed at improving working conditions and raising awareness of labour rights in 17 Vietnamese factories supplyin g consumer goods for three major retail companies (Kesko, Tuko and Stockmann) in Finland. Implemented in cooperation with the Vietnam Chamber of Commerce and Industry (VCCI), Vietnam General Confederation of Labour (VGCL) and the Australian Union Aid Abroa d (APHEDA), the project was a combination of an education and awareness raising campaign on workers’ rights and Vietnamese labour law and an auditing and evaluation process of factories following the procedure of Business Social Compliance Initiative (BS CI). The project was evaluated in 2010.The present impact study is aiming at finding long-term improvements/ changes resulted of the project in working conditions, improved practices in industrial relations, awareness of the industrial parties on workers ’ rights as well as possible changes in terms of purchasing practices and monitoring of the production chain by the Finnish retailer companies sourcing from Vietnam.The impact study will be implemented in cooperation with the Vietnam office of Australian APHEDA, which managed and coordinated the implementation of the project in 2006-2009.
